title: U2 - 2006-11-29 - Saitama - Japanese Skies (flac) [FrankFoo]
description:
U2 Vertigo Tour

Vertigo Tour 5th leg: The Pacific

2006-11-29: Saitama Super Arena - Saitama, Japan - (flac)


Includes: Vorbis tags & covers

Setlist:

Cd 1

01. City Of Blinding Lights
02. Vertigo / She Loves You (snippet)
03. Elevation
04. I Will Follow
05. I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For / In A Little While (snippet)
06. Beautiful Day / Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (snippet) / Blackbird (snippet)
07. Window In The Skies
08. Walk On / You'll Never Walk Alone (snippet)
09. Sometimes You Can't Make It On Your Own
10. Bad / 40 (snippet)
11. Sunday Bloody Sunday / Rock The Casbah (snippet)
12. Bullet The Blue Sky / When Johnny Comes Marching Home (snippet) / The Hands That Built America (snippet)
13. Miss Sarajevo
14. Pride (In The Name Of Love)

CD 2

01. Where The Streets Have No Name
02. One
03. The Fly / (I Can't Get No) Satisfaction (snippet)
04. Mysterious Ways
05. With Or Without You
06. The Saints Are Coming
07. Angel Of Harlem
08. One Tree Hill


Las Vegas (NV), Soundcheck - April 25, 1997

09. Do You Feel Loved 
10. If God Will Send His Angels 
11. Miami 
12. Bullet The Blue Sky 
13. Please 


Comments:
Live debut of Window In The Skies. Last performance of Walk On. 
This is one of three shows scheduled to make up for the postponed show that was planned to take place on 4 April 2006 at Yokohama's Nissan Stadium. This is U2's first concert in Japan since March 1998.


Concert review:

Fabulous night at Saitama. Flew down from Hong Kong for this one and the boys did not disappoint. 
From the beginning chords of Wake Up- Arcade Fire, the standard build up song before the band takes the stage, to the last chords of the magical One Tree Hill, the lucky crowd were taken through a back catalogue of some of U2's finest songs. 
The punters that showed up for this one were in good form - polite yet enthusiastic, dedicated yet respectful to others in the crowd. All that you really want when you are upfront and bopping away with the others.

Bono, ever the front man, led the troops in a soaring rendition of City of Blinding Lights, Vertigo and Elevation before hitting the old songs hard - wonderful versions of Sunday Bloody Sunday, Bullet the Blue Sky, Miss Sarajevo (with Bono even singing Pavarotti's italian part which was might impressive) and Bad was also thrown into the mix. 
The main set led into 2 full encores of Achtung Baby hits - Fly and MW and then the classic With or Without You. 
Coming back for the 2nd, they played their single Saints before closing out again with my 2 favourite U2 songs - Angel of Harlem and OTH. 
I don't think I can say more. Hearing the last song brought goosebumps and then tears to my eyes. 
May U2 live forever. It was a night I will never forget.


MultiTracker @ FrankFoo
